argument.description: Is an expression of character or binary data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column. character_expression must be of a data type, except text, ntext, and image, that is implicitly convertible to varchar. Otherwise, use CAST to explicitly convert character_expression.

description: Returns a character expression after it removes leading blanks.
sample: SELECT LTRIM('     Five spaces are at the beginning of this string.') FROM sys.databases;
